Multimedia records

Source: vignettes/multimedia_records.Rmd
multimedia_records.Rmd

Multimedia records are used to define a single multimedia object such as a document or a photo.

library(tidyged)

gedcom() %>% 
  add_media(file_reference = "media/1909_joe_bloggs_birt_cert.jpg",
            format = "JPEG", source_media = "electronic",
            title = "Joe Bloggs Birth Certificate (1909)") %>% 
  dplyr::filter(record == "@M1@") %>% 
  knitr::kable()
level record tag value
0 @M1@ OBJE
1 @M1@ FILE media/1909_joe_bloggs_birt_cert.jpg
2 @M1@ FORM JPEG
3 @M1@ TYPE electronic
2 @M1@ TITL Joe Bloggs Birth Certificate (1909)
1 @M1@ CHAN
2 @M1@ DATE 6 JUL 2021

As with other records, various types of user-defined references can be defined (user_reference_number and user_reference_type), as well as links to notes.

Next article: Note records >
